DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Biannual Ultrasonography and Annual Unenhanced Magnetic Resonance Imaging for HCC Surveillance
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose of this study is to investigate clinical feasibility of annual non-contrast magnetic resonance imaging for surveillance of hepatocellular carcinoma in high-risk group, in comparison with biannual ultrasonography. In addition, the relationship between non-contrast MR parameters and clinical manifestation of liver function is investigated.
DOC.criteria: equal to or older than 40 years under surveillance using biannual ultrasonography (USG) and presence of liver USG within 6 months (+/ 1month) risk index is equal to or higher than 2.33 (Risk Index = 1.65 (if the prothrombin activity is <=75%) + 1.41 (if the age is 50 years or older) + 0.92 (if the platelet count is <=100x10(3)/mm3) + 0.74 (if the presence of HCV or HBsAg is positive)). signed informed consent under 40 years history of HCC patients with pregnancy or nursing any contraindication of MRI any contraindication of CT
